pr_title: Issue #1405: Implemented tests for controller layer pipeline

timeline.bodyText: Probably you can always use getObjectMapper in all the subclasses.
timeline.author: tcibinan

timeline.bodyText:
Could you please extract this call to stringOf method of the superclass? I was thinking about this for a long time but now it's the time :)
Once applied we can inline all the calls in the class slightly reducing the test class size. By the way use the new method only in this pull request. We can upgrade all the old ones later on.
timeline.author: tcibinan

timeline.bodyText: Could you please extract these lines along with the corresponding assert to a private method in PipelineControllerTest.
timeline.author: tcibinan

timeline.bodyText:
Could you please use a regular assertResponse method? Also let's check that pipelineApiService.uploadFiles is called with the proper file metadata using an argument captor.
The controller method is quite an unusual one so let's test most of its logic.
timeline.author: tcibinan
tcibinan

replies.bodyText: In this case we can also get rid of new assertResponse(MvcResult, String) method.
replies.author: tcibinan

timeline.author: tcibinan

timeline.bodyText: There is no need to convert List<UploadFileMetadata> -> String -> List<UploadFileMetadata>. Additionally it would be nice to extract fileMetadataList to a method parameter and name the method something like assertUnwrappedResponse.
timeline.author: tcibinan
tcibinan

timeline.bodyText: It's better to use a type reference like we always did otherwise the assignment is unchecked.
timeline.author: tcibinan

timeline.bodyText: Let's pass these values via the method parameters.
timeline.author: tcibinan

timeline.bodyText: It's not the expected result but it's the actual one.
timeline.author: tcibinan
